title.narrative: Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research: Multilateral Contribution Window 1

description.narrative: The multilateral activities of the Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research (CGIAR) contribute directly to the strategic goals of the Australian aid program, with particular relevance to the Strategy framework for Australia’s aid investments in the agriculture, fisheries and water sectors (AFW). The CGIAR’s focus on gender and inclusive growth aligns well with the framework’s recognition that women’s economic empowerment is integral to tackling poverty and maximising development outcomes. ACIAR’s contribution to Window 1 are unrestricted, enabling the Fund Council, which is a representative body of donors and other stakeholders and the governance and decision-making body of the CGIAR Fund to determine how these funds are allocated to CGIAR, which may include allocation to CGIAR Research Programs (see below), used to pay system costs or otherwise applied to achieving the CGIAR mission.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

organisation.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
